snippet: In letters to Congressional leaders, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said President Obama directed the executive branch to stop obeying a statute that limits such benefits to spouses “of the opposite sex.”
abstract: Obama administration escalates its effort to dismantle federal barriers to same-sex marriages, announcing that Department of Veterans Affairs will immediately begin providing spousal benefits to gay men and lesbians despite a federal statute that limits such benefits to spouses who are 'of the opposite sex.'
lead_paragraph: In letters to Congressional leaders, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said President Obama directed the executive branch to stop obeying a statute that limits such benefits to spouses “of the opposite sex.”

headline.main: V.A. to Provide Spousal Benefits to Gays, Administration Says
headline.print_headline: Veterans Affairs Will Begin Providing Spousal Benefits to Gay Couples
